Uses of Package
groupOne.game

Packages that use groupOne.game
Package
Description
groupOne.game
 
  • Classes in groupOne.game used by groupOne.game
    Class
    Description
    AssetSetter
    Class sets up the locations of Assets on the 32x18 tile screen It has a GamePanel field, a constructor, and setup methods.
    AssetSetter.ObjectType
    Enum for types of objects that are in the game
    CollisionChecker
    Class checks for collision between game entities, objects, and tiles.
    Entity
    Abstract Class for the entities that will be created: Player and Enemy Contains various fields for position, speed, animations, direction, and collision detection
    Entity.Directions
    Enum for directions that the entity is facing, used for determining used sprites
    GamePanel
    Class for the Game Window, sets up the thread that runs the game, and brings all components together
    GamePanel.Difficulty
    Enum for difficulties in the game, for better readability
    GamePanel.GameState
    Enum for game states, such as the title screen or playing screen
    KeyHandler
    KeyHandler class manages keyboard input, allowing user to navigate the various game screens in GamePanel
    KeyHandler.KeyLastPressedStates
    Enum for the last pressed key, used to assist with movement and allow the player to control the character better
    Node
    Node used for the A* search algorithm
    OBJ_Reward
    Sets up reward object images and name.
    Pathfinder
    Pathfinder class for enemies to track the player on the board using the A* search algorithm
    Player
    Player class stores information about player character that can be drawn on GamePanel.
    S_Entity
    Abstract Class for stationary entities such as Doors, Rewards, etc.
    S_Entity.EntityType
    Enum for identifying object types, used to replace strings and improve readability.
    SoundNames
    Enum for sound names so that the code is more understandable.
    UI
    UI draws screens and information that can be rendered in GamePanel.
    UI_Information
    UI Information Class that holds all game information that is displayed and interacted with.
    UI_Object
    Abstract class for objects in the UI.
